title: Paying for Co-Investments Gains Acceptance Among Private-Equity Investors
sub_head: A survey shows big increases in the proportion of institutional money managers willing to pay fees on such deals
body:
Private-equity investors have pumped billions of dollars into co-investments partly as a way to lower costs. But sponsor-led transactions and competition are changing the outlook for such deals.
Traditionally, fund investors only made co-investments alongside their fund’s sponsors and didn’t pay fees or give up a slice of the investment profits to the fund’s general partner in the form of carried interest. Those advantages are becoming less vital, a recent survey shows.
